extendedIngredients.name: broccoli
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound broccoli rabe or broccoli, rinsed, ends trimmed, and coarsely chopped

title: Orzo with Ricotta and Broccoli Rabe
summary: Orzo with Ricottan and Broccoli Rabe might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 6 and costs 81 cents per serving. One serving contains 429 calories, 20g of protein, and 9g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. A mixture of orzo pasta, kalamatan olives, garlic, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 86%. This score is super. Try Broccoli Rabe & Orzo Salad, Broccoli-Rabe and Ricotta Frittata, and Tuscan Ricottan And Broccoli Rabe Pie - Erbazzone for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions: In a 5- to 6-quart pan over high heat, bring about 3 quarts water to a boil. Add orzo and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender to bite, 7 to 12 minutes. Drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups pasta-cooking water. Return orzo to pan.                                                                                                 Meanwhile, heat oil in a 10- to 12-inch frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic; stir until fragrant but not brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Add chili flakes and broccoli rabe; stir 3 to 4 minutes. Add 1 cup of reserved water; simmer until greens are tender to bite, 6 to 8 minutes.                                                                                                 Add broccoli rabe mixture to orzo with ricotta, olives, and remaining 1/2 cup reserved water; mix, adding salt and pepper to taste.

steps.step: In a 5- to 6-quart pan over high heat, bring about 3 quarts water to a boil.
Add orzo and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender to bite, 7 to 12 minutes.
Drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups pasta-cooking water. Return orzo to pan.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a 10- to 12-inch frying pan over medium heat.
Add garlic; stir until fragrant but not brown, 1 to 2 minutes.
Add chili flakes and broccoli rabe; stir 3 to 4 minutes.
Add 1 cup of reserved water; simmer until greens are tender to bite, 6 to 8 minutes.
Add broccoli rabe mixture to orzo with ricotta, olives, and remaining 1/2 cup reserved water; mix, adding salt and pepper to taste.
